Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: fatbottomzebra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tan Hotel on a girls' shopping weekend and it was great. Having stayed at many Istanbul hotels over the last twelve years, this gets particularly high marks for being quiet (trust me, this is almost unheard of in the Sultanahmet area). Yes, you hear the mosque if you have the window open, but other than that, it was lovely and peaceful, and there seemed to be no noise at all from other guests, so the rooms must be pretty well soundproofed. The staff are extremely accommodating, particularly the breakfast staff, who run what is a very small restaurant in a very efficient manner. There is a very good breakfast buffet and a choice of eggs, whichever way you want them. They also serve freshly squeezed orange juice - a lovely change from the horrid sugary 'squash' that is generally served up elsewhere in Sultanahmet hotels. Reception staff were very welcoming and helpful, right up until checkout, and the room staff were exemplary - most days we got back down from breakfast to find that the housekeeper had already been and gone. My only very small comment is that our room could have done with a little bit of a facelift and some better storage. The carpet was stained (not generally, just one or two bits where a previous guest had obviously spilt something and the housekeeping staff haven't been able to get it out), but the cupboards were awful. There was an OK wardrobe with plenty of hangers, but that was about it. Other than that, we had a dressing table with one small drawer and what looked as though it would have been more at home in an office - a kind of small bedside-type unit with one drawer - a decent set of drawers would have been great - we ended up leaving our stuff in our bags for the whole five days, apart from the bits that needed hanging up. Having said that, it is a very minor issue, though something that could easily be put right. Other plus points were good sized rooms and very nice bathrooms with good showers. We loved the hotel, especially the nice touches like being able to help yourselves to complimentary tea and coffee in the restaurant at any time of day, plus the means to make coffee in your own room. The location was fantastic, right next to the tram stop and with loads of restaurants on your doorstep. The Blue Mosque is literally just across the road. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Geweldig vriendelijk en gastvrij”
Reviews.Author: zoefje
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel excellent service ,friendly staff. Strategic place to explore the highlights of Istanbul. We enjoyed our stay in this cosy hotel. The receptionist speak amazingly good several languages.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: HappyDazeScotland
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't say enough positive things about the Tan Hotel! I emailed them a week or so before we travelled to ask for a nice room as I was taking my partner as a surprise for his birthday and they didn't disapoint and upon check in we were informed that we had been upgraded to a suite free of charge. The room was lovely, spacious and modern and the staff were a delight, each of them took the time to learn our names and greeted us personally each day. My only slight issue was that the bed was very hard for my liking and I didn't get the best nights sleep because of it but there isn't a mattress to please everyone I guess! Breakfast was plentiful and tasty with lots of cheese, ham, fruit, bread etc and eggs done to order any way you liked. Best of all was the freshly squeezed orange juice...lovely! The location is ideal if you are in Istanbul for a sightseeing trip as you are only a few minutes walk away from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace yet set tucked away in a quiet street you are still guarateed a good nights sleep. I would have no hesitation staying at the Tan Hotel if I'm ever back in Istanbul and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing value”
Reviews.Author: Holidayrequired
Reviews.Content: We turned up not sure what to expect but thought the trip advisor reviews couldn't be too wrong! Upon arrival they gave us a free upgrade to a suite as it was my partner's 30th birthday. The suite comprised of a large double room, living room and bathroom with a jacuzzi bath. The room was extremely clean and had free wifi. The staff were very accommodating and provided advice on good places to eat. They also contacted several companies that ran Bosphorous Evening Cruises until they found one that could provide for my dietary requirements... Above what we expected from them. In addition to the traditional Turkish breakfast (included in the price) they also cooked eggs to order and had fresh orange juice. The location was perfect... Very close to the main sites and near the tram spot to go to the new town. Overall a great place to stay and we would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jwolfgang9
Reviews.Content: SOrry this is a bit late...we stayed here July 2010. Very nice people running the property, great location, the rooftop views are great, and the rooms were perfect. I highly recommend Tan if you want a comfortable hotel and don't mind paying a few extra Lira.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smabarral
Reviews.Content: Tan Hotel is perfect. It's near the main attractions and the staff is very kind. It's easy to go everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Great staff”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets five stars for its location, helpful staff and amenities. It is walking distance from the major attractions and is right on the rail line, so you can always find your way back when walking. I can't say enough about the staff and how helpful they were. They were great for recommendations for restaurants, shopping and entertainment. Keep in mind that the hotel itself is a 3 star level but how much time do you really spend in the room? Breakfast was filling and the limo from the airport was a very welcome plus. Also, remember that the call to prayer is broadcast throughout the city so ear plugs are a good idea when you turn in for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: S W
Reviews.Content: Wow, wonderful value for the money! This hotel is centrally located to all the major sights - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, etc. Also, you can't beat the free pickup from the airport and free breakfast buffets. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was very modern. The staff went above and beyond expectations. When I asked for change for a big bill, the employee at the check-in desk actually reached into his own pocket and gave me change! Also, the maid staff did a sweep of the room and, upon realizing that my husband had left his suit in the closet, ran after us to ensure that we had it before we left. Also, the wireless is fast and included in the price of the room - what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paulw123456
Reviews.Content: After researching all hotels in the Sultanahmet area, We ranked Tan #1 in value, family suite size, breakfast eating area, location, and atmosphere! So, we picked Tan Hotel to stay at between Dec 11-14, 2011. The location was great, staff was most friendly and helpful, breakfast was wonderful, and the price was excellent!!! They communicated so well via email and everything exceeded our expectations. We have high expectations of hotels we stay at, and Tan definitely delivered!!! It's a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: gorgeous_bird
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay for my husbands 50th birthday. Was undecided between Taksim or Sultanahmet decided on the latter and we were really in the thick of things as far as sights were concerned. Really pleased to have booked here and definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: riempie
Reviews.Content: Central to the all the main tourist sights in Sulhamet; minutes from the Blue mosque and the Ayasofa. Grand Bazaar an easy walk away and the Spice Bazaar an easy downhill from there through lanes on shops. For the unfit catch a tram at the Galata Bridge, otherwise just head uphill via the lanes. The Sulhamet tram stop is 50 metres from the hotel down a short lane flanked by restaurants; of which there are many in the immediate area of the hotel The palace musuem is behind the Ayasofa in park area. Room was good value for money as we use it mainly for sleeping purposes. The breakfast was good, although as expected for a small hotel the selection was limited. The staff were very welcoming and willing to please. Only complaint was the poor water pressure of the shower over the bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault it”
Reviews.Author: Dan1113
Reviews.Content: -Really friendly staff -Excellent location - other than to/from the airport, we walked everywhere; very central and convenient to everything -Nice rooms -Decent breakfast, with a nice terrace -Free wifi ...and all that at an excellent price. Would definitely stay here again if we were to return to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: 1funmom
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again. Stayed six nights, booked directly with hotel and got a great rate. Not the Four Seasons and that's OK for us, but all things considered, excellent value. Hotel decor is fresh - warm yet contemporary. We were very comfortable and did not wont for anything. Service at both the front desk and the breakfast room were outstanding - everyone was particularly hospitable and made a concerted effort to accommodate and please us. Alp made numerous phone calls to confirm information and make dining reservations for us. Couldn't have asked for a better location. Tram stop just a one minute walk away, as well as main Old City attractions. Small boutique hotel with surprisingly well appointed bathroom - including really wonderfully scented liquid hand soap. Wonderful buffet breakfast with wide selection of cheeses, jams, dried fruits, whole fresh fruits, olives (did I forget anything?) was enhanced by very, very yummy made to order ommelettes, fresh squeezed OJ and homemade baked goods. Reliable free WiFi. View from terrace is partially obstructed, but lovely nonetheless. Complimentary airport pick up was easy - a contracted driver was waiting for us when we came out of customs/baggage claim. He was patient while we pulled cash from the airport ATM, and accommodated our request to stop for a large jug of bottled water. It was cold, so we slept with windows closed - Morning calls to prayer could be heard on mornings I was awake, but did not disturb. As long as you do not require the amenities of a 5 star hotel, you should be happy here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to roam the city”
Reviews.Author: Narasati
Reviews.Content: I've experienced staying at hotels and I don't easily impress. One thing about this hotel, it exceeded my expectation. Don't be fooled by its size. It may be a small hotel, but it's cozy and has everything I need. Located in the alley right behind the tram stop of Sultanahmet, its convenient location in the center of historic Istanbul made me easier to go places within walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and many others, not to forget the Turkish food vendors that provided succulent kebabs. Furthermore, the transportation from the airport was very easy, only cost me 4 TL by taking the subway red line to Kabatas, get off at Zeytinburnu, then take the blue line tram eastbound to Sultanahmet. Once I get off, I was on Divan Yolu street and immediately went to the hotel in just steps away. Price wise was reasonable, simple and fresh international breakfast at the sky rooftop and while munching you food, you can gaze to the city, overlooking to Hagia Sophia. They also provided laptop there should you wish to check your emails and such. the bathroom was provided with a bathtub with sprayer that can massage your aching body after all day of touring. Not to mention their friendly service. All and all, I truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: cheshiredavid45
Reviews.Content: The Tan in Istanbul must rate of one of the buys anywhere, location is superb just steps away from all the main sites, In the middle of the old city surrounded by all you need to have a good time, bars, shops, and super places to eat. The grand bazaar, very touristy but worth a visit is only 5 min walk away, the Roman underground Cistern even less and a must see. The beds as stated by another review are firm, not hard and I like a good nights sleep, we all got that, breakfast good, fresh eggs cooked as you like them, view awesome. All the staff brilliant, even at 4am early in the morning as we left could not do enough. Thanks to all David/Phil/Lee

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with a wonderful staff equals a great stay”
Reviews.Author: upsalamba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, as well as our two adult children recently returned home from a fantastic vacation in Istanbul. We were glad that we stayed at Hotel Tan. It's location is very convenient to all the major historical sites in Istanbul. We loved the tasty and filling breakfast on the roof terrace. Our room was clean and comfortable, and it provided an overlook to a small square in the neighborhood. But my wife and I felt that the best feature of the hotel was the wonderful and always helpful staff members. The sharply dressed front desk staff could always be counted on for directions or special requests. The food service staff, Neli and Tina, were always so helpful and friendly and kept all the guests well fed. The employees are a very international group that speak English, Russian, Turkish, and Georgian. The bottom line is...great location, clean rooms and common areas, well trained and friendly staff, tasty food and drinks, and all at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Wise Choice for Us”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraandPeter
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night after 8 nights at Tan. We are very independent travelers and this hotel was perfect for us. If we needed assistance, it was there but the staff knows how to let us go our own way. Each day started with a bountiful and delicious breakfast on the roof. The room provided all the comforts we could possibly need: great air/con (once you move the curtains away from the top vents), jacuzzi bath, good internet connectivity, a fridge. (As for the bed, it was perfect and we slept like rocks.) The hotel is steps from the tram, and just a few steps more to the hippodrome for great evening walks. There is a tiny street just around the corner that has one great restaurant after another--we tended to call it Restaurant Row. The first one off the main drag is called Mozaic. You can't go wrong, especially when you need a good meal after an exhausting day and just don't have the strength to wander far. The Cagaloglu baths are a 5-minute walk and worth every penny. You won't have a touristy exotic experience at the Tan, but you will have a safe, kind, and competent stay. We are planning a return trip and will stay at the Tan, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JKEELAN
Reviews.Content: The Tan Hotel is well situated in the tourist centre of Istanbul - 2 mins walk from the tram station, 5 mins from the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern, and 10 mins from Topkapi Palace. There are dozens of Turkish restaurants (including several cheap ones) in local streets, and the Grand Bazaar is only10-15 mins away. The Hotel stafff are very helpful and friendly. Like most Hotels in Istanbul, breakfast is included in the room rate; a made-to-order omlette and freshly squeezed orange juice are offered free. However, if you arrive towards the end of the sitting you may find that the more popular items on the menu have run out. The rooms are quite nicely furnished and clean. The major drawback is their size - they are very small and not really big enough to house more than two people. We booked a room for 3 and the room was so cramped that there was not enough space to move around without bumping on beds or bags etc. The lift is tiny - the smallest I have ever seen - and not able to hold three people with their bags. The aircon unit was a bit outdated and not particularly effective. The TV worked and had access to BBC and French news in addition to Turkish channels, which seems to be better than many Turkish hotels. Bathroom decor was very nice, but the shower unit over bath didn't work very well and temperature control was erratic. The beds were hard, but sleepable, but the noise from the nearby Mosques calling the faithful to prayer was very intrusive and not conducive to long sleep-ins.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: brinck
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Tan in sept. From the start, the service was great. Any queries were dealt with immediately and professionally. We arranged a transfer to and from hotel thro the hotel and found their rates very reasonable. It was such a time saver to be met and transfered. The hotel even let us have breakfast on our day of arrival (6.30am) and store our luggage until room was ready. Our room was also upgraded from a triple to a suite which was a bonus for our party of 3 adults. I think they felt sorry for us when they saw the size of our suitcases!!!! The staff service was excellent, from the front desk to the 2 lovely ladies who made our breakfasts- fresh orange juice and omelettes! The rooms were spotless with fresh towels every day. Perhaps, they could check their a/c as these weren't super efficient. We would go out siteseeing and get back to enjoy sundowners on the rooftop terrace, tea and coffee also available on the house. Tram stops close by and within walking distance all main sites, but still in a quiet little street. We enjoyed the fact that there were many restaurants around to choose from, yet seemed to be away from the maddening crowd! A small hotel Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But...”
Reviews.Author: RJES
Reviews.Content: First off, the Tan Hotel is an excellent choice when you consider it's location. It is right in the heart of touristy Istanbul (Sultanahmet) and a minutes walk from a tram stop. It is also no more than a few minutes walk from some of the major sights: Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern to name but a few. Secondly I have to pay a big compliment to the staff at the front desk who all spoke good English and were most helpful. Also the breakfast, while not being the widest choice I've ever seen in a European hotel, was pleasant enough with a freshly cooked omelette cooked to order and delicious freshly squeezed orange juice. The bathrooms also come with a jacuzzi bath which is a nice touch. However, there are some down sides. The terrace bar (which has a stunning, if slightly obscurred, view of the Blue Mosque) closes at 11pm which, while in keeping with other businesses in the surrounding area, is a little early to close up in my opinion. In any case you're better off heading down to one of the bars or restaurants under the bridge where the beer is much cheaper (6TL for half a litre of Efes) and are open to the small hours. Also the beds are VERY hard. Not impossible to get off to sleep but I had fitful sleep every night. And I wouldn't describe the rooms as air-conditioned as they have extremely inefficient air-conditioning systems. Don't expect an icy cool refuge from the heat of Istanbul here. I would recommend this hotel however as what it gets right, it gets very right. If I could give it three and a half stars I would. Istanbul is a great city as well.

Reviews.Title: “Tan Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JBSTITCH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tan Hotel for four nights. I booked through WWTE (Expedia) and selected the Tan because of its location and reasonable rate. The Tan Hotel cannot be beaten on location. Situated in the heart of the historic district of Sultanahmet the hotel is less than five minutes walk from all the major tourist sights including Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern. The staff are also extremely welcoming and helpful. Breakfast is served from 0700-1030hrs each day. On offer is a selection of bread, cheeses, cereal as well as a small selection of cooked meats and pastries. The staff also cook eggs to order and provide freshly squeezed orange juice. I found that the selection of items were not always replaced if you chose to breakfast later in the morning. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace which has a stunning (but partially obscured) view of the Blue Mosque. I would however question some of the claims made by the hotel on their website. I would not agree with the hotel claim that it is a boutique hotel. While the hotel is small and the rooms comfortable, the hotel is not luxurious or intimate as the phrase 'boutique hotel' might suggest. The hotel also claims to have a 24-hour terrace restaurant however the terrace was only open from 0700-2300hrs and the only food available was breakfast. The rooms are air-conditioned but the system is not particularly effective. I ended up relying on keeping the window open to keep the room cool. This worked fine for me but some guests may be bothered by the increased noise that could be heard from the surrounding area as a result of having to do this. I should add that these are all minor irritations that did not detract from my overall very pleasurable experience staying at this property. Overall a very positive experience at the Tan Hotel and I would definitely consider staying there again during any future trips to Istanbul. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, basic option - but definitely NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Datruf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tan for 5 days. Situated in the center of touristville, it's very convenient with regards to seeing all the major sites. It's quietly situated on a non-busy small street. Breakfast views are splendid. Breakfast options are the same every day. Eggs and fresh squeezed orange juice. The staff is polite and reserved. We decided to extend our stay by one day and were forced last minute to pack our belongings and move to another room without much of an explanation (after complaining, they did give us a small discount). a few things to look out for: a transfer to the airport is provided if requested, but it'll cost you twice as much as a taxi costs. There's a clothes washing service next to the hotel , but he'll charge you $30 dollars a load! You can negotiate with him but he's greedy. I will also warn you that their beds (as most we've discovered in Turkey) are like sleeping on wood planks or cement blocks. Our backs ached daily. In traveling quite a bit, I can comfortably give this place 3 stars. You're not going to get room service or a robe. Your remote on the TV will act up from time to time. But overall, if your searching for a simple, no frills stay, this will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scotcan12
Reviews.Content: A couple of minutes from the street with the trams on it and easy walking distance to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Our twin room was pretty spacious with lots of natural light and a good-sized bathroom. Breakfast room at the top of the hotel was great and the terrace was accessible during the day and in the evening too. There's a small launderette next door but hotel laundry was affordable (unlike so many european hotels where it's almost cheaper to buy new clothes than have them laundered!).

Reviews.Title: “eccellente”
Reviews.Author: malpassotu
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel... People from the desk are extraordianary kind... The location is perfect... the price is honest for a suite... Breakfast good with a very nice view of the Blue Mosque and Sulthanamet area... with pleasure I suggest this hotel to everybody who wants to visit Istanbul, one of the most beatiful town in the world...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: regular-traveller25
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, and very good value. Location is great, staff quite helpful, the rooms are clean and very complete. Did not get to try the breakfast, since left early morning. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, quiet, great views from roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: vale6770
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Istabul as a family of three in June 2011. We researched many hotels and found that most travelers were dissatisfied with either the small size of the rooms in Istanbul hotels, or the noise from the street, or the lack of functioning air conditioning. Hotel Tan scored the highest in all the above categories. The rooms are adequately spacious, the bathrooms newly remodeled and impeccably clean, and we could hear no noise from the street despite the central location of the building. It was wonderful to walk to the Blue Mosque in five minutes as well as enjoy the view of the city from the roof terrace at breakfast of for a night drink. In addition the staff was courteous to us and professional helping out in any of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “The best time of my life”
Reviews.Author: arhaghani
Reviews.Content: Tan Hotel is definitely the best place you can get with this budget. I was there with my Girlfriend and we had THE best time. The people there are more than nice and kind, the location couldn't be better, the rooms were extremely good. You can also write them and book transfers from the airport to the Hotel and vice versa. If you wanna have a good time in beautiful Istanbul, i can strongly recommend Tan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: pbs69
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a great location at a reasonable price. very friendly and accomodating staff and overall we rate it a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Fab view and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Emiliebecker
Reviews.Content: The rooftop garden has an exceptional view of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. While breakfast is free, and thus garners the most business, th real treat is the sunset view. I do not know whether the staff are screened and hired because they are nice and helpful or it is just the kindly view that the Istanbullus take toward tourists, but the staff were exceptionally pleasant toward our numerous inquiries. I would go back in a heartbeat because they were so easy. The location was sublime, and minutes from the tram, which is one of the better examples of a large cities' public transport success. Internet coverage was a bit spotty at times, but it is hard to know if the problem was a general lack of bandwidth coverage at the hotel, or something larger related to Istanbul wifi service.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secret”
Reviews.Author: Faro22
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay in Istanbul and I must say that Tan Hotel helped me a lot to feel my vacation this way. I have just arrived from there and it is impossible to keep me away fromTrip Advisor to write this review, because my impression is as clear, nice and vivid as it was the time that I'd spent in Istanbul's best hotels choice. Tan Hotel was a hidden gem at Sultanhamed neighborhood - walking distance to the most important tourist spots in town. Do you want to visit Blue Mosque? Well, just cross the street. Sofia ? A few more steps away. Topikapi? Five minutes walk. Have a good meal? You don't even need to cross the street. There are several restaurants nearby and most of them are great. Want to be pampered by a nice Turkish welcome? Stay at the hotel and drink a haki (the local and delicious Turkish drink) at Tan Terrace enjoying the stunning view of the mosque. It's the same view you will get at breakfast - the best way to start your day. Have a talk to the recepction staff and get very nice hints on how to spend your vacations. Congratulations! You made us feel at home. By the way, I was travelling with my wife and my parents. My father is 91 years old and they give him a very special attention in every detail (like booking proper tours for elderly people, reserving lower floor's room, being considerate at his breakfast choices, etc) Longer stays at the hotel include free transfer from the airport. What else shoul we ask for??? Thanks Tan Hotel!!! Hope to be in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast but not the best value!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_World
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the tan hotel between June 7-10 in a double room. The hotel gets top marks for location (2min walk from sultanahmet tram stop but not noisy!) and a fabulous view of blue mosque/hagia sophya from the breakfast terrace. The room is adequate sized and furnished in a modern style- sheets are clean, bed is comfortable. But poor marks for the room air-conditioning system, which just isn't good enough for a hot summer day and the bathroom- cranky shower (only does scalding hot or icy cold!), faulty exhaust fan (we asked the staff to get it fixed every day without success). So overall, only average- if location is your primary need, this hotel is perfect but don't expect the best service or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel in Sultanhamet the Epicentre for Istanbul Tourists”
Reviews.Author: senior_traveller60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as family for a joint holiday treat. The location is perfect for a city break to Istanbul. It is in an almost "secret location", in the back streets. You can emerge within minutes into a major street DIVAN YOLU. Sorrounded by dozens of restaurants, shops, and turkish sweets shops (yum). The Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, the Cistern, Blue Mosque, Ayia Sofia and TOPKAPI are all minutes away. Tram stops and taxi ranks are also minutes away. There are at least 3 Hammams (turkish baths) within 5-10 mins walk !! Perfect location. The service, breakfast on the terrace (with views of many monuments), the hygiene standards are all justify the 4 star rating. The front desk staff (Alp, Kaan and Edirm), were extraordinarily helpful, knowledgeable and no request was too much trouble. The ambience of this hotel seems like it is long established institution, and yet it has only existed for 4 years, converted from a printing press !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZ PAUL
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Tan Hotel. Staff was very helpful. Nicely updated rooms. Rooftop bar/restaurant has fantastic view. And it's location can not be beat!!! Great experience at the Tan Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Approachable Staff, excellent location, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissierulz
Reviews.Content: We initially booked this hotel as for the namesake (as my surname is also Tan). Upon arrival, we decided to explore as the hotel is conveniently located two minutes walk from the Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia and the underground cistern. Also ideal for stepping out in the evenings to soak up the buzzing atmosphere. The hosts couldn't be more graceful in this family-run hotel, offering free flowing freshly squeezed orange juice and delicious egg omelettes for breakfast. The rooms were faultless with complimentary , but could perhaps benefit from renovating its decor and brightening colours and investing in a more modern lift (as we had a lucky escape!) All things considered, this offers excellent value for money for city explorers.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael_London_N4
Reviews.Content: The helpful and professional staff at this hotel made the experience memorable. Nothing was too much trouble. In particular the two ladies from Georgia who run the restaurant were really welcoming and their joyful disposition certainly upped our moods. The rooms are very comfortable. But the glass door to the bathroom is not ideal- particularly as there is a gap between the door and the doorpost all the way around the door. All in all a terrific hotel which we wholeheartedly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel,superb location”
Reviews.Author: alistairs84
Reviews.Content: the hotel is 25 mins by taxi from ataturk airort (19 euros) but could be easily reached by the excellent tram system which is 100m from the hotel at the bottom of the road, the hotel was very clean and nicely furnished, the staff were helpful and friendly,the buffet breakfast on the roof terrace was amazing, the roof terrace view of haiga sophia and the blue mosque especially at night were stunning, the location is genuinely within 400m of all the attractions of sultanahmet, the tram at the bottom of the street takes you to anything further afield quickly and cheaply, just buy a token and away you go, in conclusion for vising the cultural area of istanbul this hotel is wonderful, we will be going again.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: taqi
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the tan from april 11-17th. On arrival we were upgraded to a suite for the night due to over booking but we didnt mind as the suite was lovely. This hotel is one of the best that i have stayed the staff are very friendly and helpfull and always willing to go the extra length. Breakfast is great freshly squeezed orange juice although it would be good to perhaps have different options every couple of days. The blue mosque hagia sophia topkapi palace are all 5-10 minz walking distance overall on my return i would only stay here thank you to all the staff for a lovey stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: serifl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tan hotel last week with my mum and cousin for my mum's birthday. On arrival at the hotel the staff were very friendly and helpful and we were immediately made to feel welcome. We booked a triple room and I was really surprised to see how spacious the rooms were, we had a lounge area which was seperate to the bedroom. All were comfy and clean. My only complaint was my bed was a bit hard but each to their own, after a long day of walking I was out like a light anyway so it didn't affect my sleep too much. Also the TV had very limited channels, but again we weren't really there to watch TV! The room had free Wifii which was also brilliant and very handy! The breakfast on the terrace was lovely and had a lot of options. Athough if you stayed for longer than three days then perhaps it could get quite repetetive. Overall the hotel is in a fantastic location, it is literally a two minute walk to the tramline which takes you to all the sights and costs about 0.70p one way. Also a short walk to the kapalicarsi and the Sultan Ahmet Mosque is literally across the road and can be seen from the roof top terrace of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the middle of everything and have easy access to all the popular spots. I would stay at this hotel again as the staff are so friendly and helpful, the hotel's manager even helped us with our luggage to the car! Haven't had that kind of hospitality before! Overall a fab trip and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: koolass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tan Hotel for 10 days in the beginning of April 2011 and I cannot recommend it highly enough. This small, intimate hotel is staffed with the friendliest and most accommodating staff I've ever come across in my many travels. The room was beautifully designed and impeccably clean with a WONDERFUL bathroom and a charming view. Every morning they have a free breakfast buffet stacked with fresh meats, cheeses, yogurts, fresh squeezed orange juice and delicious omelets made to order. The rooftop room and balcony was where we spent every night overlooking the Blue Mosque with fresh coffee and very, very sweet hotel staff. Though the price was extremely reasonable, if I had no budget limit I would still stay here. The location, steps from ancient history and right on a main Tram stop, can't be beat. There is no way I would stay anywhere else if I was in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lark01
Reviews.Content: More or less everything you want from a value for money hotel. Fantastic location with all the major sights and activities within walking distance; spotlessley clean and wonderful staff, from reception to room maids. They could not have been more charming and helpful. Breakfast was good - delicious omelettes and freshly squeezed orange juice - but limited fresh fruit and inconsistent coffee. The rooms could do with a refurb - the relentless brown and beige got to us after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Redjer
Reviews.Content: A little gem of a Hotel with excellent staff , good breakfast and a great location. Even though we arrived late in the evening the Reception Staff Kaan and Tugba in the Bar looked after us very well. We had an excellent suite room with all modern conveniences. The suite is worth the extra charge per night as you have a sitting room, bedroom and full bathroom all tastefully decorated. Rooms spotlessly clean, good choice of breakfast food items It is a small hotel with very high standards. One can walk to all the major attractions in Sultanahmet. Plus there are a number of excellent restaurants within five minutes walk from the hotel. I would recommend Amedros, excellent Menu and first rate staff. Also Sarnic and Faros restaurants serve good food . Caan,Tugba and all the Tan hotel staff were both extremely helpfull and friendly throughout our entire stay. I can recomend this hotel to anyone intending to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVrieswijk
Reviews.Content: The Tan hotel is a great hotel, very good service, kind people and a good location. We are coming back again if we are going to Istanbul again!!

Reviews.Title: “lively and lovely”
Reviews.Author: jatinvora
Reviews.Content: nice location, heart of istanbul, near the historic place like sultanahmet area, capalicarsi, nice staff and warm welcome, nit and clean rooms are big and clean breakfast is lovely and delicious great hotel for stay safe too

Reviews.Title: “super little hotel excellently placed with great views and service”
Reviews.Author: Lewknor
Reviews.Content: found this hotel on web and it "does what it says on the tin" - unpretentious but great value, especially good breakfasts which were in the price, held in their nicely designed roof terrace with excellent views of the blue mosque, Aya Sofia and the Bosphorus, even in the rain. Less than 100 metres to Sultanahmet tran stop and all the major sights in this area. Yet it was quiet, and very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast in a great location”
Reviews.Author: email_iandsmith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Tan Hotel on our Honeymoon and were pleasantly surprised at the friendly service and facilities at this hotel. The view from the dining/bar area on the top level was excellent and the breakfast was excellent with freshly made eggs and omelettes, freshly squeezed orange juice and a huge range of other treats. My only criticism would be that they sometimes seemed a little under-staffed. We had to take our own bags to the room in the tiny lift which was a little awkward and when we had an issue with the safe it took some time before anyone could come and have a look at it. The location is superb as you are right in the middle of Sultanahmet (Old City) and it is only a 100 metre walk to the tram stop. The staff were able to offer good advice on where to go and where to eat but I would recommend eating outside of Sultanahmet. Head over the Galata Bridge to Beyoglu for great shopping and food. Warning: Be prepared for a loud 'praying' from the Mosque at this hotel. This would bother many people as was very loud in our room. I did however enjoy the sound as it made you realise that you were most definitely no longer at home.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: frieda1234
Reviews.Content: excellent location,very friendly and helpful staff, clean,very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dirk1974
Reviews.Content: Tan Hotel has everything you need when you are on a citytrip! Beautifull rooms, with jacuzzi , free internet, every day cleen towels and sheets, coffee in the room, safe( free) , modern interr. Breakfast was more than satisfying, fresh o.j. , eggs any way you like, different kinds of bread, fruit, cereal, cheese, juices, .... Perfect location, quiet and in a few minutes you are in the centre of Sultanahmet . Great experience, the kindness from everyone who works in Tan hotel gave us a welcome home feeling, they really create an extra star for the hotel ! : )

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, helpful staff, room v nice, breakfast good. Overall Superb”
Reviews.Author: Cardigan_and_Blondie
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is second to none. All The Biggies within 5-7 mins walk (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern). It is virtually impossible to knock it at all. Everything was spot-on. They even loan you a laptop if you haven't got one. Free coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice through the day as well. The nearest I can get to criticism is that the kettle leaked a bit (they changed it) and the bedspread was a bit too retro for me. You only get one pillow each as standard as well. I would definitely stay here again. If booking a suite, ask for one above 1st floor, as the sound of the cafe owners putting out the chairs and tables might possibly disturb light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveller883
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in the Tan Hotel in September 2010 and can thoroughly recommend it. The rooms are a good size, the breakfast served with a view of the Blue Mosque was probably the best we had in a month touring Turkey. Best of all about this hotel is the wonderful staff and the location which is walking distance to most things and very close to the tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Liwid
Reviews.Content: I recomend this hotel if you go to Istanbul! The hotel has clean nice rooms, really nice breakfast att the roofterrace with a magnificent view where you also can enjoy a glas of wine in the afternoon/evening before going out in town. It is close to town, to the mosques, trams, restaurants, the grand bazaar, turkish bath and they have very friendly and serviceminded staff!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant pearl in the centre”
Reviews.Author: highfive49
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky that we choose the Tan hotel. In the middle of Istanbul historical center. Good andclean rooms, a very good breakfast buffet, possibilities to sit and have nice view of Istanbul with free coffe and water during the day, friendly and serviceminded staff. ItÂ´s really value for money

Reviews.Title: “A great location just a few mins walk...”
Reviews.Author: Irnbrukidsm
Reviews.Content: A great location just a few mins walk from tram stop. Close to some of Istanbul's major attractions. Great reception staff. Buffet Breakfast, served on a roof top terrace with great views, is superb getting the day off to a great start. Rooms are modern and very comfortable. Nothing to fault during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “In the midst of atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: roberta48152
Reviews.Content: A small, clean hotel, with free internet access and nice rooftop for a decent buffet breakfast. The service was fine; concerierge was the best. Liked the idea of stepping out the front door into a local outdoor restaurant, or can just continue on to others. Close to the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, The Cistern , shops, ...reasonable price for a nice place in Istanbul & loved the free internet

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solomiz
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel! The coziest and most welcoming hotel we have ever stayed at in Europe. Itâ€™s quite new and has already gained quite a reputation. Location is right on the center of everything essential to enjoy -- right on the core of the Sultanahmet district. We wanted to be within walking distance of the action and main attractions â€“ Topkapi, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Egyptian Bazaar, the port of EminÃ¶nÃ¼, the mosques and this was perfect! Our room was ready when we arrived, and they promptly dispatched housekeeping to please us on any extra or complimentary amenities that we may have required. Room was not too small and nicely appointed. An ample five table terrace deck overhands the old city while eating a most appetizing breakfast â€“ fresh juice, eggs any style, appealing local fruit, breads & cheeses, etc. The front desk staff, Alp and Eidem, and the cafÃ© crew meticulously looked after by Kaan was super helpful, professional and friendly. Location is wonderfully quiet despite being in the heart over everything. Tramway, is top moving vehicle in the city, and its station is just one block away but a million miles way as far as noise and crowds. Great value, and highly recommended. S. Mizrahi

Reviews.Title: “Identify your priorities”
Reviews.Author: PaulaJK
Reviews.Content: This small family run hotel has a marvelous location in Sultanahmet w. easy access to major sights,cafes and restaurants. Front desk is sweet although night person is somewhat 'laid back' [He barely helped w luggage]. Elevator is tiny so you struggle w. luggage. Our room was clean and decently equipped but a rather drab brown decor. A./C was adequate. The roof top terrace is a nice feature although it overlooks shabby buildings as well as marvelous sights. There is a computer there for general use and the feeling that staff wants to be responsive. This is a hotel for those who can deal with low key features.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a perfect location with attentive staff and a wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: drmsl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modestly priced, but offers everything you would want in a hotel. The staff were friendly, attentive, helpful, and professional. The room was very nice, with a comfortable bed, and the hotel is in a great location. The inclusive Turkish breakfast on the roof was fantastic and again, all staff worked to ensure that guests had a great experience. Overall, a fine hotel at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CanberraIntrepid
Reviews.Content: This a small boutique hotel in an excellent location. Modern decor , large comfortable bedroom and bathroom;complimentary internet access and all day tea and coffee. Very nice breakfast on the patio with views of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. Lots of good value eating places nearby. Excellent staff. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but hotel had bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Delsey2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location and staff were very friendly. However, the hotel had no air conditioning and if you had the windows open you could hear a noisy street below. We got bitten by bedbugs the fist night and asked to change to another room, which was possible. Both rooms had broken showers - you could mainly only get cold water. The hotel says on its website that they have a restaurant on the top floor which is untrue. There is only a bar that serves drinks, no food. In general the worst hotel we've ever stayed in - mainly due to the bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home and with a welcoming smile”
Reviews.Author: JMConroy
Reviews.Content: For my Mothers 60th birthday in July I surprised her with a 3 night stay in the Tan Hotel, Istanbul. We had a fantastic time with great weather and Istanbul proved to be an amazing city with so much to see and do. The icing on the cake however was the Tan Hotel and particularly the staff who work there. From the planning stages the reception staff were only too willing to answer my many emails with questions and even offered a free bottle of wine to my Mother as a birthday gift from the hotel. On our first night we received complimentary fruit and cheese to accompany our wine as we drank on the roof terrace and admired the magnificent view of the Blue Mosque. The location of the hotel is perfect and within walking distance to all the main attractions and the tram. Thank-you to all the staff at the reception, the roof terrace and even the cleaners for always having a friendly smile (rare in many hotels these days) and for helping Mother and I to have truly memorable break in Istanbul. We hope to see you again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: allegraalessandrap
Reviews.Content: Tan hotel is a really confortable place and Mr Erdem is a so kind gentleman. Thanks to the whole staff. P.S. the espresso coffee is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: chel2010
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel in Istanbul. There were 4 of us over for a long weekend and it looked fairly central. The local was amazing - minutes walk from all the main attractions and right near the metro too. The staff were really friendly and very helpful. The hotel was really comfortable and really clean. There was no noise filtering through either! I'd definitely recommend this to a friend - especially an omlette breakfast overlooking the blue mosque!

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: RRRossmann
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and another couple to Istanbul. We wanted to explore the city and the Tan hotel was a great location for starting from. Right next to the blue mosque etc the great choice available at breakfast served on the terrace was the perfect start to our day. The hotel rooms were cleaned well daily and were plenty large enough. The hotel has wifi that is so simple to connect to and the staff are very helpful, they booked tables for us at Reina and other trendy eateries in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel - great location, spotlessly clean, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: henrycrossley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate 60th birthday with family. Hotel is ideally situated for Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern - all within 10 mins walk. Also, Sultanahmet stop on excellent tram service (air conditioned) is 2 mins walk away. Rooms spacious and spotlessly clean with good bathrooms. Air conditioning unit works sufficiently well and keeps your room nice and cool if you leave it on all the time you are out on the town! Reception staff are exceptional - unceasingly helpful, informative and pleasant. Breakfast is brilliant, with a choice of fruit, cereal, breads, variety of eggs, coffees and teas. It also benefits from being served on the roof terrace with a view towards the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Really can't think of a negative, which is unusual for me. Recommend this hotel to anyone - I'd certainly stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “It Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Jeri_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five days visiting our son in Instanbul in June. After researching many, many hotels we chose Tan Hotel because of its location, cost, and rooftop terrace (a recommendation made by our son). We were very happy with our choice. We had a suite which consisted of a bedroom with a king bed and a small living room. The room was rather plain, but very clean and afforded excellent free wi-fi availability. The bed was very comfortable after long days of sight-seeing. Breakfast (good variety and very tasty, including fresh-squeezed orange juice and made-to-order omelets) was served on the terrace, where we had a view of both Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. We gathered there every evening for a beer and to enjoy the magnificent view. The hotel is just steps away from the major sights and the tram, which made sight-seeing very easy and efficient. The staff is very pleasant and helpful with tips on what to see and how best to get there. They even moved things around a bit to accommodate our request to stay two extra nights. Our son plans to live in Istanbul for another year, so we will be back to the Tan Hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff and good value - made for a memorable trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Brown671
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tan Hotel for four nights in late July as a group of four (two couples) and had booked through lastminute.com. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring the sights of Sultanhamet, it is also close to a tram stop which makes for easy travel to all other areas of the city and the airports. A fantastic breakfast is served on the roof terrace that has stunning views over the Blue Mosque and this really sets you up for the day. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and after a few hours seeing the sights it was always nice to return to the hotel to recharge the batteries before going out again in the evening. The staff were welcoming and extremely helpful from start to finish. Recommending places to eat and making reservations for us at restaurants. In summary, the Tan Hotel is the perfect place to stay as a base to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Istanbul's Old City”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly111
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Tan Hotel for a week in June, 2010. The location is perfect - 2 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, and the other sites. The hotel is clean, neat and modern. The room was clean. We did not have a room with a view, but didn't mind as the room was at the back and very quiet. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace. It was great having breakfast looking out across to the sea. We were pleased that the tram stop was also a 2 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: cerca
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and this hotel had the nicest staff I have ever run into. There are not a lot of American travelers around and we knew nothing of the city. The staff gave us suggestions and helpful instructions every step of the way. The lady up in the restaurant was from Georgia and didn't speak English, but no matter we communicated just fine and she makes the best omelet I have every had in a hotel. The other lady up there bent over backwards to get me extra puffs to make the bed softer for me and enjoyed chatting with my friend while we had drinks. Fantasic location, super friendly staff all around, English speaking staff and well, all tourists should pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: mcfaddent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tan for four nights. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was excellent. The staff was quite helpful when we needed directions or reservations. You could not ask for a more convenient location to all of the major attractions ( Ayia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and the waterfront for cruises). Everything was within easy walking distance. From the rooftop you have a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Best service at this charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honkeytonk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 4 day stay here and can thoroughly recommend this hotel. The reception staff, Alp and Kaal were efficient and very helpful and nothing was to much trouble for them. As we had an early departure, staff put plates of food for b/fast in the fridge the night before and at 5.15am, came with large glasses of freshly squeezed orange juice. The hotel is centrally located to major sites in Sultanahmet area and on a return visit we will stay here. A bonus is breakfast on the terrace with views of mosque and St. Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “felt safe & at home”
Reviews.Author: siuf17
Reviews.Content: small but lovely hotel.very convenient, within walking distance to Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia & Topkapi Palace. Literally just steps away from Sultanahmet Tram station which is great. and plenty of restaurants around the hotel. good size room & always kept clean. The view of the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia from the Terrace is magical esp. in evenings. All the staff were just so wonderful, helpful & friendly making me feel so at home. Special mention goes to Alp & Kahn from Front Desk who gave me invaluable info on what to do & always helpful & patient in giving me directions over & over again :) Also to Mustafa from rooftop Terrace who served me my wine with a smile always. courteous & well informed guy who gave me interesting insights about the beautiful city of Istanbul & Turkey as a whole. not forgetting Tico & Nellie who showed me such warmth. Thank you all for making my trip special & safe! will be back! Siew Fung Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Position, Position, Position & rooftop breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travellingman69
Reviews.Content: As the title states the position of this hotel is a great advantage almost everything you will want to visit is within a short walk away and if itâ€™s not you can take the nearby street train. There are also many restaurants in the area. Breakfast on the rooftop is very enjoyable with the view of the Blue Mosque along with some other landmarks visible and we found it to be very pleasant to have breakfast there. When we booked this hotel via the internet a pick up from the airport was included and the van and driver were waiting for us on our arrival at the airport. As far as the room is concerned it is a no frills basic room of average size without chairs and the beds are very firm (it does have a foot seat to sit on at the desk but it is too low for comfort). There is a mini Fridge, Safe, Coffee making facility and a quiet running AC but the lighting in the room is very poor and the TV is a small flat screen mounted on the wall with very few English speaking channels. Wi-Fi is free but is very slow most of the time. The bathroom is reasonably modern but there is very little space on the sink for our items and the water in the shower keeps changing from hot to cold and back to hot on its own. The staff is friendly and helpful. If you can get a good price its worth staying here. Pictures are attached. Happy traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrreat!!!”
Reviews.Author: cem4lon
Reviews.Content: My brother, friends and myself stayed at this very central hotel for 4 days and we experienced the most cordial welcoming, friendly service and lovely rooms. The hotel is very clean and the staff very agreeable. The roof terrace is spacious and the views stunning. Breakfast is abundant and varied and the waiters attentive, in particular Mustafa behind the bar. The hotel is walking distance from all main attractions and surrounded by good quality and reasonably priced restaurants. We can't wait to go back to this fantastic city and, most definitely, to this charming Turkish hotel. Mariana, Geoff, Eddie and Carlos

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first time visit”
Reviews.Author: FelixBucks
Reviews.Content: Overall impression of hotel was very good. Fantastic location - just five minutes walk from all major sights and tramway. The rooftop terrace gave a panoramic view of whole area around the Bosphoros. Room was well equipped although a little dark. Staff were friendly and efficient. Would certainly recommend to friends and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Realy a romatic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed_Hamdi
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, friendly stuff, very clean room, excellent location near to tram and most of important location like Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia... etc. in fact, this is excellent hotel to stay for lovely period and romatic life.

Reviews.Title: “" TAN... the place to sto stay when you visit ISTANBUL! It's just in the name!”
Reviews.Author: Sandytje
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a good place to stay during the visit. It's in the historical part of town. You can visit lots of places just walking. The hotel has all comfort and a super great terrace on top where you can take breakfast, just in front of the Blue Moskee. Great! During the day terrace is available for free coffe or tea and free internet! The staff is so friendly! When I go back to Istanbul, it wil have no problem to choose, just TAN in IsTANbul!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JenGill59
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise the service at this hotel highly enough. The staff are all very professional, but friendly too, they really care that you are happy. The room was a good size with a spa bath as well as a shower en-suite. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was amazing and not to be missed, as were the evenings we just sat up there with a drink from the bar to relax. The hotel is just a short walk away from the nearest tram stop (the best way to travel), and we also found a very good restaurant nearby (The Karadeniz). I would not hesitate in booking this hotel if I were to travel to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location - excellent staff - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tim301240
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel in the best part of Istanbul to see the sights then this is it! A 3 minute walk from the hotel and you are right next to the Blue Mosque, the sultans palace and all the other sites in the Sultanahmed district. 15 minutes walk and you are in the Grand Bazaar and if you want the cultural sites then a tram stop is 2 minutes away and then a 15 minute ride into that part of town. Hotel was very comfortable, rooms were clean, tidy and the air con was perfect - upon arrival (following our free pick up based on us booking 3 nights) we where shown to our room and there was a bottle of wine and some fruit and cheese to welcome us!. cannot say enough about the staff from Alp on the main desk to all the staff who cleaned our room, served us breakfast or who were just happy to stop and chat for a while - friendly and proffessional is my impression. Alp organised a cruise for a day and also recomended a couple of places to eat, that said there are hundreds of places to eat on your doorstep so dont worry about finding somewhere! 10 out of 10 !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Emailit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tan Hotel for 3 nights in May 2010. The hotel was in a great location with a large number of restuarants within a couple of minutes walk and less than 2-mins walk to the nearest tram stop. Most of the sights were within walking distance with the Blue Mosque just 5-mins walk away. The room itself was large although it had 3 beds (two joined together to make a double) which made it rather cramped. Other than a small frdige and tea and coffee making facilities the room was fairly standard/basic. The bathroom was ok but again only standard but equipped with a bath (with jacuzzi) and shower above the bath. The main downside with the rooms was the thin walls which made it all too easy to hear the next door neighbours laughing and talking until the early hours on the first night. That said it probably had as much to do with the lack of consideration from the neighbours as it did the thickness of the walls. The definite plus side with the Tan Hotel was the complimentary tea and coffee facilities which were available on the roof top terrace all day long until 11pm and the breakfast (again served on the roof top terrace) which was also pretty good. Would recommend as a good base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Recommandable”
Reviews.Author: joseph6233
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed with three other couples in the Tan Hotel in Istanbul, a pleasant, quiet hotel with good rooms right in the centre of the Sultanahmet area. It is located at walking distance from all main attractions, as Haya Sophia, Bleu Mosque, Topkapi palace and Grand Bazaar, and 50 meters from the tramstop. The staff were extremely friendly, from the front desk to the waiters in the breakfast room where each morning we enjoyed a delicious and extensive buffet. The breakfast room is located on the top floor, with a fantastic view over most important highlights Also located on the top floor is a wonderful roof terrace, great for afternoon or evening drinks. The bar was operated by Mustapha, a very friendly student economics who went out of his way to make us comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed a drink in his 5th floor bar. We were very happy to have chosen this hotel. What a wonderful city is Istanbul , with its very friendly people. Josephus and Mechtild.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: HowieBoldon
Reviews.Content: We were caught in the ash cloud and stayed for 12 nights instead of 8.The staff were marvellous showing concern and assistance were it was needed and helped some of the other guests considerably.Great location for the old city and 100 yards from the Sulhanmet tram stop.I had 2 rooms and the one on the front was larger and much brighter with a view of the surrounding streets.Breakfast was very good and the views from the roof terrace were fantastic.I used many of the local resteraunts and all were ok.The fish house nearby was among the best but several facing the Blue Mosque have roof terraces and while the food was ok the views were terrific.We used the Istanbul Airport Service to get us in from the airport as we arrived to late for the free tan hotel collection.They were waiting for us on arrival and new exactly were the hotel was.Great place to stay and i recomend it fully.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: phi4wisdom
Reviews.Content: That is exactly what hotel Tan felt like. The location is simple ideal.. steps away from the tram and within a 10 minute walking distance to the fantastic Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi and most sights including the Grand Bazaar. The staff are extremely professional and kind, frequently going out of their way to assist weary travellers. Their personal interest in every guest is one that leaves you with the feeling that you are among friends.Aip and Erdem at the front desk were always helpful and caring, especially because i was a solo traveler and they would unfailingly ask about my day and always be of help.Kan, who assisted at the front, was ever gracious and so very courteous. The breakfast crew at the rooftop cafe were humbling in their affection and warmth and in their efforts to accomodate the needs of each guest. Thank you Nelli, Tiko and Tene so much.I miss you guys.Thanks also to Mustafa , who handled the rooftop cafe in the evenings with great aplomb and who was always helpful with tips and suggestions. The room i had was a standard and was very spacious, clean always and with a spacious and clean bathroom. There are all those amenities needed to make the stay an extremely comfortable one and one that i will always cherish... Thanks all..and finally ...Go Fenerbahce!!!(Sorry Aip..i can't support Galataserai... :-)))

Reviews.Title: “Tan hotel”
Reviews.Author: manxboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a side street opposite a small Mosque and school, so if you sleep with your windows open you may hear the early call to prayers, we did and rather liked it. location for all the main tourist sites is excellent, plus loads of shops and places to eat as soon as you open the door. The bedroom was adequate perhaps a fresh colour scheme wouldn't go amiss, but maybe we are been pedantic. Huge comfy bed. Bath room was okay. Very clean and tidy. Breakfast is served on the top floor overlooking the rooftops and Blue Mosque, which is a grand view. The food was mix of continental and local style with fresh pressed Orange or Pomegranite juice every day, quality and quantity was good. Hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly and eager to help. A real credit to the place. Always knew answers to our questions and ready to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ethanEngland
Reviews.Content: First impressions were excellent with staff carrying luggage to our room. This impression stayed with us throughout our four night trip with staff being attentive and courteous. Our room was comfortable and the breakfast , which was varied and plentiful was taken on the roof terrace which had tremendous views across Sultanhamed. This is a good three star hotel situated in probably the best location for viewing the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: lifeatseaforme
Reviews.Content: Very nice, centrally located hotel in Sultanahmet. Modern, clean and excellent hotel staff. They could not have done more for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Istanbul (Sultanahmet)”
Reviews.Author: Mimi_GM85
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul and the Tan hotel helped to ensure that we had a fantastic time. The staff are all very professional and friendly. Alp, Tico and Mustafa in particular were really lovely. They are always happy to answer any question you may have and provide tips to make your stay in Istanbul a really great experience. Particularly nice is the roof terrace on which you can have breakfast with a splendid view of the Istanbul skyline, including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and the Bosphorus. Breakfasts are delicious with a huge choice from the buffet and Tico's excellent omelettes. The hotel is very central, meters away from many of the main sites. We will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: spazdafish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 8 nights and thought Tan Hotel was fantastic. Both Alp and Erdem are friendly and ready to assist with suggestions and general information about Istanbul. Free transfer to the hotel-just make sure to confirm since I'm not sure if they have this on the weekends or after certain hours. Great location right off the the SultanAhmed tram-great for going to Taskim and to other parts of Istanbul and of course it is walking distance to all the major sites. Rooms are clean, nothing too fancy. There's a safe and a mini fridge. I guess my only two complaints is that our room sometimes smelled like someone was smoking which I probably would contribute to someone down the hall and that the tv has limited channels-both very minor things. We weren't able to connect to the internet since our laptop had some weird safety features but there are 3 computers for everyone to use. Excellent free breakfast 7:30-10:30 am consists of fresh pomie or oj juice, eggs made any style and a load of options-bureks, yogurts, nuts, tea, coffee, bread, etc. The breakfast staff is really great and friendly. Oh and great view of the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia from the terrace!! Highly recommended!! -Naser and Cynthia

Reviews.Title: “EXTRAORDINARY”
Reviews.Author: WienTravelqueen
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the very heart of the old town Sultanahmet near quaint bars and restaurants (the Fish House nearby I can highly recommend), just a step away from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The terrace and breakfast room provide a magnificent view overlooking the Mosque, the Bosporus and the Marmara Sea. I was overwhelmed by the friendliness and special attention we received at this hotel. Alp at the reception is an Angel. For breakfast you receive individual special attention and freshly squeezed juice and fresh omelettes etc. in addition to the buffet. Personal free airport pick up with a friendly driver. The whole staff is superb, attentive but not obtrusive. I am a very demanding person and I have to say this stay was extraordinary and comparable with a 5 Star experience in terms of service and staff. The rooms are simple but spacious and clean. The staff at the TAN Hotel made our stay in Istanbul very special (it was my Mom's 70th birthday and we got special tretment, amenities and kind congratulations) and I am looking forward to the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Saffronmk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Istanbul for 5 days. We booked at the Tan Hotel based on the reviews online and in guide books. The rooms were clean, had plenty of space and insulated enough that we could not hear call to prayer at times. Breakfast was amazing on the rooftop, fresh squeezed juices...yumm! It is perfectly situated, easy to get to and from other areas from the train. I must say that the staff really made the entire experience come together. They were helpful, friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable AND happy. Thank you and we WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in and amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located about 100 yards from the Sultanahmat metro stop. Very close to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The hotel is modern, rooms a good size and comfortable, bathroom clean and well appointed. The reception very curtious and always prepared to help. There is an internet computer in the bar at roof level and one in the lobby bar, I understood that there are connections in the rooms but I overheard one guest saying he had been waiting for two days for another guest to release the cable! The breakfast was very good and included in the price, eggs anyway you want, bread, pastries, yogurt and friut., fresh juice every morning. The hotel offered a free collection from the airport if you stayed more than three nights, ours was a three night stay and they offered the collection at 25 euros (for 4 persons) and a return at 20 euros - we thought very good as our flight was dealyed by 1 hour but the driver was waiting. The view over the roof tops of Istanbul from the breakfast terrace is amazing - the Blue Mosque and HS close enough to touch - almost. The rubbish on the roofs spoils some of the aspects. The roof has part outside tearrace - but we were inside as it was Fbruary and raining. The metro is a good way to get around 1.5 TL (about 60 pence) is good value. The spice soul less intimidating than the Grand Bazzar. Go over bridge on the tram to Karakoy and go down subway trun left coming up on the other side wall a few meter and take small tunnel train to the top of the hill to Tunel - walk back down to the Galata Tower - view form the top fantastic. Great city, great people - beware of the manic bazzar traders, friendly but very much in your face and no matter where you come from they will know it, have a brother, daughter, uncle, grandfather - who has been there, stayed there or has a house there!! You do not need (or want!) a car in the city, lots of restaurants close by. Good European food - not cheap Â£25-Â£30 for evening meal - you can get cheaper. We ate in the FarosRestaurant out on the main road - from the hotel go to the main road, turn right 100 yards - not too much hastle on the door. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “x):::>--- absolutly fantastic ---<:::(x”
Reviews.Author: benjaminLondonUK
Reviews.Content: hi there, excellent service, lovely breakfast, very friendly staffs, nice and clean room, every things was perfect, and just 1 minute to tram station, we will be back again definitly. x xx x

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DoctorPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Tan Hotel was conveniently located, as clean as my own home, extremely comfortable. but the best bit was the members of staff, who were all very friendly, helpful and hospitable. Nothing was too much trouble, advice was happily given, and the breakfast on thr roof top was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good and safe choice.”
Reviews.Author: SPMarco
Reviews.Content: Nice location and staff very friendly, mainly the guy in the reception (Alp). He was always kind and prompt to help for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly, great location -- pretty close to perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Urogdi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect choice for a long weekend in Istanbul. The location is awesome (steps away from the historical sights) -- the hotel provided pick-up from the airport, helped with getting around, and recommended us places to go out at night in other areas of the town. During the day, you can walk to the museums and other sights -- and at night you can cab it (pretty cheap) to nightclubs in Taksim. The hotel is really modern and clean and stylish, with all the extras of a nice hotel -- but without the hefty price tag. What we liked most were the terrace, the breakfast, the service and the up-to-date, modern style of the place (which, as far as I could tell, is not typical of mid-range hotels in this city, which tend to be kind of old school in their design and service style). The pictures on the hotel's website are a totally accurate representation of how it looks. We will definitely come back to this hotel (as well as to Istanbul!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Monkimus01
Reviews.Content: Absolutely averything was spot on, very friendly staff always happy to help, delicious breakfast with a range of choices (as well as fresh omlette and squeezed orange juice), beautiful views acros the city and bosphorus from the rooftop terrace. All in all i would give it a 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: johanbakken
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the hotel is located perfectly for tourists who want to experience Istanbul. The service was flawless and the breakfasts were wonderful, with an omelette and freshly squeezed juice every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and modern hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: jdtCanda
Reviews.Content: We moved from an unsuitable hotel into the Tan Hotel and we felt like we were in the lap of luxury. We were welcomed by wonderul staff and a very clean and modern room. The location is perfect for seeing Istanbul for the first time, close to the tram and all the historical sites. Lovely rooftop breakfast, fresh squeezed orange juice and a great cup of coffee!! and the view from the terrrance is fantastic. Amazing views of the city at sunrise or sunset.

Reviews.Title: “absolut perfect hotel, central location and very friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: parosklaus
Reviews.Content: after having visited only in 2009 more than 20 different hotels in different parts of Europe we stayed for a week in Istanbul at the TAN hotel - absolutely perfect in all conditions. Very central location, but very calm. 1 minute to the tram station, 5 min walk to the blue mosque, 5 min to Hagia Sofia. Very friendly stuff - always attend and giving good information. A superb breakfast buffet with almost everything, daily changing. Free use of WLAN and also free use of a computer. A very clean room with daily changing of towels and bed-linen. What more could you expect - we will recommend it to everybody - and hope, to find still a free room at TAN hotel on our next stay to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back to hotel Tan”
Reviews.Author: PeBeZuidLimburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights in hotel Tan and we will go back there the next time we go to Istanbul. Is has a perfect location, it is in a quiet street although it is near to all the places of interest like Haya Sofia, the Sultan Ahmet Mosque, the Bazar etc. We had a a nice room with clean linnen every day. The breakfast-buffet was extensive with a choice for everyone's taste. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Thank you, we enjoyed your hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DPooley
