Reviews.Content: If you want a good hotel in a great location for a short trip to Istanbul then the Tan Hotel is the place to stay. Minutes walk from the Aya Sofia museum, the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque, it is so easy to get everywhere on foot. Sitting one street back from the main street, the hotel is quiet - apart from the calls to prayer from the minarets of the nearby mosques! Loads of great restaurants and bars to choose from all within a couple of minutes walk. Breakfast at the Tan Hotel is simple but good - fresh orange of pomegranate juice to start the day on the terrace with wonderful views across the rooftops. My only complaint was feeling a little misled by the website showing the dining room set for a spectacular dinner - we planned to eat there on our first night - but they don't actually serve dinner! This wasn't a problem in the end as the restaurants close by were great. If I am back in Istanbul, I will be back at the Tan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel`”
Reviews.Author: Park0009
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience with this hotel. The hotel is in a prime location at the Sultanahmet tram stop making it easy to visit the many tourist attractions in the area. Positives: The customer facing staff spoke good English and were very friendly The breakfast buffet and quality of food was excellent The staff provided great directions around the city to various exhibits There was plenty of hot water for the shower Negatives: Bathroom could have used some more light Poor wifi signal throughout the hotel The Blue Mosque's calls to pray are loud

Reviews.Title: “Tan hotel could not be faulted”
Reviews.Author: boltongirl12
Reviews.Content: Tan hotel was a gem and would not hesitate in recommending it. We had booked 3 nights and then, horror of horrors, we missed our flight from Luton. We emailed the Tan and explained and asked for an extra night at the end. They were lovely, didn't charge for the missed night and although they were full for the 3rd night, went to some trouble to find us alternative accommodation for the last night and even drove us there! The hotel is clean, modern and friendly. The room was lovely, and the breakfasts were superb, lovely selection of fruits, fresh orange juice made individually for you - nothing was too much trouble. We enjoyed istanbul and will no doubt be visiting again and would definitely stay at the Tan hotel again. Should mention that the location is good, we walked to all the historic sights, and walked in the evening to restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent midrange price hotel in Sultanhamet area”
Reviews.Author: Grueben
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated about 200m walk from main tram line and just a few minutes walk from Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Loads of restaurants nearby. Entire hotel is spotless and the rooms are a good size. Breakfast is included and is served in the roof bar / terrace which has fantastic views over the city. Very good hotel and considering some of the prices around that area this is a lot of hotel for the rate (about 100 Euros a night). Breakfast included freshly squeezed orange juice and fresh omelette. Big spread of jams / cereals etc

Reviews.Title: “Good, not the best”
Reviews.Author: lioness73Athens
Reviews.Content: Positive points: The location is great: you are in walking distance from major sights like Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and Top Kapi. The hotel is clean and the personnel friendly and helpful. The bathtub has a (sort of) jacuzzi system which helps you relax. The terrace where breakfast is served is really nice with a view to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and a glimpse of the Bosporus sea. Breakfast was good. Negative points: Noise. At around 5.00 a.m. the Muslim Priest starts singing religious songs really close to the hotel. A parking is located right outside. The rooms are not inspiring. Mostly brown colors. Overall I was happy staying there and nothing bothered me too much, in fact the positives are more than the negatives. Maybe you can find a better deal, but if you chose that hotel, you will not feel disappointed. I would not recommend for a couple that wants to experience romance (go somewhere closer to the Bosporus), but I would definitely recommend for a group of friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, breakfast, location and cty!”
Reviews.Author: DBOnline
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Istanbul staying at the Tan. Stayed here based on Tripadvisor recommendations and have to stay fantastic. Great location in a quiet street in Sultanahmet, close to Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. Hotel is extremely friendly, big rooms, great roof terrace and breakfast, friendly staff and a hotel dog are perfect. City is full of life and incredibly interesting Some nice restaurants around the corner make this a nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: zotwist
Reviews.Content: In May 2008 my wife and I stayed at the Tan Hotel for a total of seven nights.Â  It's location is great - in an interesting area, very close to cafes and restaurants and near major tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque. The room was spacious and comfortable. The roof terrace, where breakfast is served, provides spectacular views of the city.Â  The staff were very friendly and helpful (they let us leave some of our bags at the hotel while we did a two-day tour of Gallipoli and Troy).Â  We will definately stay at the Tan on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “View form the roof terrase will take your breath away!”
Reviews.Author: DirkUtrecht
Reviews.Content: A most pleasant hotel, situated only a few steps from a stop of the Tramway, but hidden in a labyrinth of small streets, without car traffic. A house of strong character - but surprisingly comfortable; a spacious room with airco, minibar, bath, ... High value for money. But the main feature of this marvelous hotel is the roof terrace at the 5th floor; the view to the Blue Mosque, the Haiga Sofia and the Bosporus takes your breath away.

Reviews.Title: “Great roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Tegasamaki
Reviews.Content: The terrace makes the hotel. Great location and friendly staff as well. Good breakfasts as well.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice in Sultaanamet (old city)”
Reviews.Author: 46k
Reviews.Content: Nice medium size hotel with a great location right by the blue mosque and aya sophia. Staff is very competent and helpful. Rooms are nice. Furniture is all very new but also cheap and low quality, so it's great untill it starts breaking. We had the hanger-bar in the closet falling out and some issues with the light switch. Neither were a big deal. There's a very nice roof terrace where they serve a very good breakfast. Unfortunatly no dinner/lunch is served upstairs (drinks only), but you can get takout and take it there and order drinks. The hotel is on a small street just off the main street of the old city (Divanyolu) and no taxi driver will be able to find it based on the small street name. Instead, you'll spend an hour driving in circles. To get there ask for the Sultanahmet Metro stop on the Divanyolu. The hotel is 25 meters away from there. This is a great base for sightseeing. If you want to focus mainly on going out I would stay in the new city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: coolheart
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Tan Hotel in Istabul. The hotel is centrally located to visit many of the tourist sights. The room was large with a very nice bathroom. The staff were courteous and very helpful. Great breakfast on the terrace with a fantastic view. All this for an excellent price. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: fooddock
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tan wa conveniently located in the Sultanamet section so close to the attractions but it was sufficiently hidden from the street for privacy and quiet. The hotel staff were very friendly. The view from the roof top made our best photos and the breakfast was fit for a king, or sultan!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL, LOVELY ATMOSPHERE IN THE HEART OF ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: NicolaParis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in tan otel for 6days with my friends and it was wonderful and very comfortable.TAN Hotel is located in the center of istanbul so it is very easy to go everywhere from hotel(to historical places,to pubs,to good restaurant,night clubs,shopping centers).The rooms are very comfortable and enough big,The staff is very friendly and they never disturb you and they help immediately when you have any problem.I should also add that the breakfast which is already included to the price is very very delicious. If you want go to istanbul you should stay in tan otel and you spend a wonderful holiday there. Thank you TAN Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, bit noisy, uninspiring decor.”
Reviews.Author: BolderLondon
Reviews.Content: We (myself and father) spent three nights in the Tan Hotel in April. The location was fantastic, really near the Blue Mosque and Topkapi, restaurants and parks. The staff were really helpful, the breakfast was very good in the rooftop restaurant with great views. We found our room really noisy as there was a small but very busy car park below our window. The room itself was clean and functional but a bit bland, quite dark, all brown/tan, no pictures or anything to liven it up but this isn't a major problem if you're out all day.

Reviews.Title: “The place where I would come back”
Reviews.Author: Bluewave1
Reviews.Content: We ordered weekend via website and there was was free transfer to hotel. We arrived at night and they delivered us to the place. I absolutely fell in love with view of the city on the roof of this hotel. Nice music, view of the city and wounderful breakfast. Rooms are very clean and well designed. The staff is extremely friendly, care a lot about tourists and create relaxing atmosthere. I can say that I would definitely come back once again to this place and will recommend my friends to go there. Location is perfect as its close to all main attractions of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...if you actually get to stay there...your booking isn't necessarily guaranteed...”
Reviews.Author: KB77London
Reviews.Content: Despite reading about some similar experiences on TripAdvisor we decided to give it a chance. However, on arrival we were told that there had been a flood and that they needed to move us to another hotel for 1 night before an alternative room would be available for our second night. I was immediately filled with dread and anger but they insisted that they were upgrading us to a more expensive hotel (the Sulhanan which was quite grand and traditional although I preferred the Tan) and that they would upgrade our 2nd night to one of their suites as well as paying for our return taxi to the airport. To be fair, they were true to their promises and they also transferred our bags between the hotels so it wasnâ€™t actually too much of a hastle. The Tan hotel itself was quite impressive, located in a quiet street while being close to the Old Town sites and with great views from the rooftop terrace. The rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. While I would recommend this hotel, I do so with an air of caution and suggest contacting them before you arrive to ensure your booking is guaranteed and hopefully avoid them pulling this (suspected) stunt on you.

Reviews.Title: “It's just right for all your Istanbul needs.”
Reviews.Author: dandoon83
Reviews.Content: The place was recommended by my cousin and what a great rec. I've stayed in all kinds of hotels all over the world (first and tourist class) and as a first time traveler to Istanbul this place was PERFECT. It's a short walking distance to 3 major sites (blue mosque, aya sofya, topkapi palace) and the Keiser Wilhelm fountain and the obelisks square. Surrounding areas includes small bazar plus rows and rows of restaurants and a few small gardens. It's clean, modern and the view on the terrace for breakfast is priceless. They have an adorable little resident to greet you when you first come in (chippo the dog). The staff were really nice and helpful which is not the case of most service providers in Turkey. Naturally anyone should check the bill before they check out but these guys have no hidden motives.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: az71
Reviews.Content: A stroll away from the Cistern, The Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace and of course Haghia Sophia this lovely hotel was a brilliant recommendation, which I must pass on. It's located near a tram stop, which means that the other main parts of the city that you will want to visit for bars and restaurants are accessible. The staff were charming and very helpful, helping us to navigate the city. Rooms were very clean and the bed was lovely and comfortable. A good buffet breakfast is served till a very civilised 10 am and I recommend sitting out on the terrace- you can see the Blue Mosque in all it's glory- particularly beautiful at dusk or night with the call to prayer in the background. The hotel has a gorgeous little dog who potters about charming everyone. It really is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: paulkenny100
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Tan Hotel for five nights and what an amazing experience....staff were excellent, so friendly. Location could not have been better. You are right beside all of the top sights and literally one minutes walk from the metro....which brings you everywhere you need. Compared to other hotels its up a side street where there is no noise from the train or passing traffic. Also the breakfast is excellent - so beautiful sitting up there in the morning enjoying the sights! Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in Istanbul, metro can bring you into Taksim and the facilities are excellent - free wifi was a nice plus!

Reviews.Title: “Tan Hotel - great, but check your invoice on check out”
Reviews.Author: jasoncrh
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel overall. I was here for 4 nights. the hotel dog is GREAT!! and the location - so convenient for all the sights, and easy access to the tram to go to the hip side of Istanbul - Beyoglu and Istiklal Road. ONE PROBLEM. When I reviewed my bill, there was a charge for a minibar item - a piece of chocolate. I complained to the front desk person - I hadn't eaten it. He refused to take this off the bill. He said that the maid would not have made a mistake. I was pissed. Granted, it was 3:30 am and it was only 4 lira, so I let it slide... but still, it's the principle of the thing. Had it not been so early I would have argued for longer, but I was exhausted and had to go to the airport, so I let it slide.... Overall, though, the location is great as are the views from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Manuela_Eduardo
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in Tan Hotel. Itâ€™s in a great location, very quiet and just few minutes away walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia & Topkapi, 10 minutes away from the Grand Bazaar, 3 min. away from tram stop "Sultanahmet". The double room has a good size, breakfast is good & located in the roof terrace which offers beautiful views to the Blue Mosque. People from reception are very nice, helpful, kind and really made our stay a great pleasure. Very good value for money. On top of that, youâ€™ll meet a very special friend who is the real soul of Tan Hotel and so loved by everyone who stays there. Thanks Chippo for being so special! We miss you!!!! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well-located, with charming owners”
Reviews.Author: Celinemarine
Reviews.Content: We spent a three-night stay in Istanbul in late March this year and chose Tan Hotel. We were definitely happy with our choice! The hotel is close to the tramway line in Sultanhamet, 5 minutes walk to three main sights (Aya Sophia, Sultanhamet Mosque, Basilisk Cistern), 15 minutes walk from Topkapi and its museums, approximately the same from Grand Bazar... Within 20 minutes walk or 10 minutes tram you reach the harbour. Close to everything and yet it is very quiet. Some people say it's best to choose an hotel in Taksim rather than Sultanhamet, because of the restaurants and stuff, but we were glad we stayed in Sultanhamet. It's nice to be able to come back and rest between visits. Besides, there are very nice restaurants in this part of the city too, especially for a three-night stay. We had a superior room, which we found spatious, very clean, and pleasant though a bit bland maybe. The jacuzzi in the bathroom was a very pleasant touch after a long day outside! The owners and staff are particularly charming, gentle and helpful. They gave us lots of advice, and good ones too! The views from the terrace are not as spectacular as shown in the hotel pictures. However, it is very pleasant to have breakfast there, and food is fresh and good (fresh fruit, tomatoes and cucumber, five different kind of Turkish cheese, Turkish pastries, and the usual tray of bread - cereals - ham - honey - yoghurt - butter - jam). In a nutshell, we were very pleased with our choice and would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “You absolutely MUST stay at the Tan Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: belinam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tan Hotel Istanbul and really enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful! The location is great too, right in the middle of the city. And the view from the rooftop terrace, amazing! Highly recommend the Tan Hotel Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Astagro
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have a perfect vacation. Their is lovely personals, beautiful view from terrassa and very nice rooms. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nikola”
Reviews.Author: NikolaBGD
Reviews.Content: This is very nice and quiet hotel. We stayed for five days, and we did not have any complain, just opposite the rooms are great, the food is very tasty and the service is on high level. We hope that we will be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TamaraBelgrade
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Tan hotel for most pleasant time in Istanbul and first of all i want to thank them for unbeliveble service and quality. Whole expiriance worth more then they charge. See you next year for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Merely OK, not as good as the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at this hotel as a precursor to a cruise that started in Istanbul. Overall, the hotel was OK but nothing special. Pros ------- * Hotel is in a great location - a block or two from the historic sights * Furnishings are modern * Breakfast on the roof-top cafe is pretty nice - foodwise as well as the view Cons -------- * Pictures of the hotel are deceiving - most of the time the lights in the lobby are off, so its actually much darker than in the official photos * The bathroom is modern but again the lighting was pretty dark. * The shower didn't have a full glass door, only those half-doors they have in Europe. The floor got very wet after a shower. * Our room was in one dark corner of the hallway and the hallway ceiling was especially low in front of our room - bumped my head twice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rmurgas
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Istanbul, and chose this hotel based on the reviews it had on Trip Advisor. We were picked up at the airport by a private driver and taken to the hotel which is located in the Sultanahmet area. This is were the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace are located. The location is perfect for many reasons. If you want to get on the double decker buses, the stop is just down the street from the hotel. The Grand Bazaar is a 10-15 minutes walk. There are many restaurants and cafe in that area to satisfy every need: Local food, American, Italian, etc. The hotel itself is wonderful. We stayed in room 102, which is a suite, with a separate living room. Nicely decorated and well appointed. Very comfortable bed, nice sheets and quilt. The living room has an LCD TV, which offers about 4 English channels. The remaining are Turkish, French or Italian. The room also has a mini bar, which is very expensive (about $6.00 for a Coke). The Hotel offers breakfast on the rooftop, which offers you a nice view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, and this is included in your room rate (breakfast and the view). It is a boutique type of Hotel, with a reasonable rate, close to the main historical and tourist attractions. If life takes me back to Istanbul, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Wanted to charge full stay even though we called. Rude service.”
Reviews.Author: Mcanuck
Reviews.Content: we had a 5 night reservation and went to the hotel and stayed for only one night. we decided to find a new hotel because: 1. front desk guy was extremely rude 2. elevator was broken for over a day and our room was on the 3rd floor (they said the lift would be fixed but it never was) 3. room furniture was old 4. bathroom was very dark 5. our room was not ready at check in even though we arrived at 10pm at night - really In the end we decided informed the clerk that we did not want to stay but would stay one more night since the policy stated they needed advance notice. shockingly, he wanted to charge us 100% for all the other remaining nights anyway. huh? awful. DO NOT TRUST THIS HOTEL. BUYER BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Tan staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisee98
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all who helped with taking emai messags and for the laptop and internet access while we were visiting Istanbul in Sept while hurricane Ike was visiting our gulf coast home. We enjoyed our stay at the Tan and in Istanbul despite the issues at home.

Reviews.Title: “Bait And Switch”
Reviews.Author: nonameUsa
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a convenient location. BUT, we went by the hotel before our stay to make sure reservation was intact. It was. The next day when we arrived we were told a sad story about a sick guest who couldn't check out. Therefore room not available, and then we were sent to another hotel. Maybe so, but at the other hotel we encountered another guest there with the same story. They had also been shuttled. What kind of scam is this?? When one has a limited time in a destination, it is better not to waste time waiting for taxis and to be shuttled around town. Too bad because the place is clean, the bathroom is modern and spacious and the help is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: mpoac08
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to experience the best of Istanbul on a short stay this is your hotel. With a fantastic staff, especially with the help of Onur and Cihari, we were able to hit all of the highlights in every category. The breakfast and evening hours can be enjoyed with there amazing rooftop with views of the blu mosque and bosphorous. Very clean. I have traveled extensively though Europe and this is one of the best Boutique hotels I have ever staye. I HIghly recommend. Cheers, Mark and Eileen

Reviews.Title: “Scam Operator”
Reviews.Author: Anton_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself might be good. I'd have written a nice review if it had not been for their manager, some Cihan Ordu. Mr Ordu is pretty good at operating scams. Here is my experience. Our stay was booked 2 months in advance, guaranteed by credit card and confirmed. A day before arrival I got a phone call from Mr Cihan Ordu and was iformed that all of their bathrooms were out of order, so they wouldn't be able to accomodate us. He proposed "a partner hotel" instead, namely, Aziade Hotel. Also, he promised a free transfer as a compensation. They never provided that transfer, we waited in vain at the airport, and we finally got to the Tan Hotel by taxi, we saw their hotel full of guests. Apparently, all of those poor guests were excreting in the nearby street, or that was what Mr Ciahan Ordu wanted us to believe. He asked for a payment on the spot, refused to accept a credit card, and charged us 80 Euros per night at Aziade Hotel, though Aziade Hotel website stated clearly their price was only EUR60. We had our flight early next morning, so we weren't too fussy, paid our Euros to Mr Ordu the Scammer and headed for Aziade. By the way, Aziade wasn't a bad choice. Shame we were lucky enough to come upon them through Mr Ordu. You want to be cheated on - go to Tan Hotel and ask for Mr Cihan Ordu. He will deliver!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis on the Pennisular”
Reviews.Author: hairywoo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Tan hotel as an overnight stop on our way home from Bulgaria. The Hotel is ideally placed for those who want to be on the doorstep to some of Istanbuls's greatest treasures. The staff at the Tan were friendly, courteous and helpful. The rooms are clean and fresh, although our a/c wasn't that great. Reception were very helpful allowing us to check out late at 4pm at no extra charge. There is an amazing view from the roof terrace, although it was very quiet when we visited - ideal for a quiet beer and to get your bearings though!! All in all, a great 1 night stay and we will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: Laujijua
Reviews.Content: Our experience in Istanbul would not have been the same in a different place. Not only the place was awasome in terms of location, cleaning and comfort, but also people were amazing and really helpful. For us, it was like being at home. Location is perfect, as you are just one step from tram and from main areas of interests, but at the same time, street is quiet you that you can rest after your long walking days. Breakfast is amazing, you can enjoy at the same time tasty fresh food and views!!! It is also nice to interchange some impressions with the rest of the people staying in the hotel, as well as get to know people from different countries, as the enviroment is really friendly. For sure I highly recommend this place for you trip to Istambul. A great value!!!! Laura

Reviews.Title: “Quiet , clean & modern hotel close to sights”
Reviews.Author: Spiderchick
Reviews.Content: The Tan Hotel was a great find in the middle of the busy Sultanahmet area. The rooms were modern and spacious and our room had a separate sitting area with a small mini bar and a flat screen tv that had a few English stations. The rooms were bright and sunny with large windows but had good black out drapes to keep the morning light out while we recovered from our jet lag. The bathroom was large and there was good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The complimentary breakfast had plenty of options for all, both sweet and savory. The staff were friendly and helpful, specifically the manager Tahir who was most interesting to talk to about Turkish life and culture and had numerous tips on what to see & where to eat. The hotel is ideally located. It is walking distant to numerous sights and the tram stop is 1/2 block away. I happily and enthusiastically recommend this hotel to other travelers visiting Istanbul who wish to stay in the Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “The Best-Kept Secret in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: BabyBabyNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The Tan Hotel was one of the best travel experiences that we have ever had. We found it online and took a chance based upon the website and favorable reviews on TripAdvisor. When we arrived, we were greeted personally by the General Manager, Tahir. He had our room ready shortly after our arrival, even though we were several hours early. He also called us the next morning to tell us that he was holding the kitchen open for us as we were about to jet lag ourselves out of breakfast. The view from the roof terrace is lovely and the breakfast served every morning is a wonderful way to start the day. The staff is very friendly and provided excellent service every morning. Throughout the stay, Tahir took it upon himself to make sure that we were having a good time and always gave great advice regarding sights, restaurants, etc. The hotel's owner, Ercan, was also a wonderful and gracious host and made us feel very welcome. The room was very nice and represented an excellent value in an expensive city. It was clean and well-appointed, as was the rest of the hotel. Another nice touch is the free internet access both in the lobby and on the roof deck. We will fondly remember beginning our days with coffee and ending them with wine on the roof deck. All in all, I don't think that one can do better for having a personalized hotel experience at such a reasonable price. We would highly recommend the Tan Hotel and will definitely stay there again should our travels take us back to Istanbul. Beate and Neil from New York City, USA

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: IndiaAra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tan Hotel in early April. The location of this hotel was the clincher - not only is it close to all the major attractions in Sultanahmet and the eating joints (imp: there is no 24-hr restaurant in the hotel) but also to the tram station, which makes all the difference if travelling with kids. wake up early & head to the breakfast terrace to catch the sun breaking over the blue mosque - while you chow on the best cake and fresh made-to-order omlettes! amazing views of the blue mosque and hagia sofia. the rooms are comfortable, the staff quite friendly - especially Tahir. will definitely stay here when in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: 330driver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in mid May, based on reviews on this site. The best room rate I could find was on the hotel's own website. Make sure you print out the map there and take it with you if you intend arriving by taxi as the hotel is a little hard to find the first time (GPS co-ords: N41Â°00.519' E028Â°58.520'). Itâ€™s located in a backstreet (which looked fairly safe and well lit to me when returning there late one night) just a few steps from the main thoroughfares of Sultanahmet, although with no passing traffic the place is very quiet. The Old City itself is fairly compact, so all major sites are within easy walking distance. The rooms themselves are a fair size for this part of the world, with the small Jacuzzi in the bathroom a real bonus for reviving legs aching from a day's sightseeing. There seemed to be no shortage of hot water, and they also have an automatic backup generator (which we only found out about when the power failed to the area one night). The staff were excellent, with plenty of pointers and eager to help make our stay in Istanbul enjoyable. After Istanbul we drove down the coast to Bodrum, stopping at Gallipoli, Pergamon and Ephesus. They provided plenty assistance with hire cars, maps and good recommendations for en-route hotels (Crowded House in Gallipoli, Bella Hotel near Ephesus). Iâ€™m not really a breakfast person, but what was on offer was comprehensive, with a great view of the Blue Mosque from the roof terrace. While there are plenty of good restaurants nearby, try not to miss the Beyoglu experience near Taksim Square for an evening meal. The only real criticism I have is the sign on the mini bar fridge: â€œYou canâ€™t keep your own drinks/snacks in mini barâ€�. As far as Iâ€™m concerned if Iâ€™ve paid for the room I should have use of all facilities in it, including the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Position , Stuff & Cleanness”
Reviews.Author: Taksidiotissa
Reviews.Content: Whise Choise 12/5/2008 That was my 5th trip to Istanbul but the first to stay in Sultanahmet area and allthough Taksim is concidered more "in" area I would definitely recomand Tan hotel as the best choise if you wan to be just in the real heart of Istanbul. It is in an excellent strategic position and everything is just from 2 to 15 minutes walk ( Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia, Top Kapi, Basilika Sistern, The Big Market, the Spice Market, the Sirkesi train station where the Dervish show is talking place, Gagaloglu and Chemberlitas-the two mosf interesting hamams- ) And even if you wan to go to a more distant place, such as Pera , Istiklal Kadesi etc you just take the tram - the stop is just one minute away from the hotel. The position is very important because this way you are avoiding the "dead time" of the really heavy trrafic in Istanbul. The cleanniness of the room was very satisfactory -change of towels, sheets and duvet cover every day-. Excellent was also the view from the breacfast room on the 5ht floor, with the asthonishing view of the seagulls flying over the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophtia with the font of Vosphorus sea. Special mention deserves the stuff for the wormth and heartfull compliance. Tahir the hotel manager was really polite and did all he could to answer to our needs. Among others he arranged for delivery superb food one rainy night that we did n't want to go out, on another occation he arranged for the hotel car to get us to a nearby place in order to find it- it was a rather complicated adress. We were a group of 14 and we are all saying that one of the reasons our trip was just excellent had to do with Tan hotel. The only problem we encountered was with the sofa of the suite wich is ruther short for an adult to sleep. I would definitely recomend Tan hotel and even if it is not a luxury 5 star hotel( as the ones I stayed before in Taksim area) is very satisfying and pleasant and is a whise choise that combines area, service and decent rooms. Nearby are also some nice places serving traditional food and great sweets.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mirzadj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I was in Istanbul on our honeymoon and we stayed in Tan Hotel for seven wonderfull days. We Loved the Tan Hotel because of its convenient location and for its friendly staff. We loved having breakfast on the rooftop restaurant with the most beautiful view of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Tan hotel is clean, fresh and very friendly. The room we stayed has a great bathroom with jacuzzi ! The atmosphere in the hotel is warm and friendly. Everyone in this hotel was so welcoming and nice. The Manager Tahir is a great guy who makes everyone very welcome. We particularly liked interesting conversations with Tahir and he gave us some very useful tips for places we wanted to visit there. We can highly recommend this hotel, it's Excellent! I hope to be back to Istanbul soon and we will definitely stay in Tan again. Mirza & Elma, Sarajevo Bosna I Hercegovina

Reviews.Title: “What a friendly and clean place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: VanDelden
Reviews.Content: Just home after 5 very nice days in the Tan hotel with my sister and 2 friends. Everything was perfect for a very reasonable price. You are in the middle off Sultanahmet were you can walk to different beautiful things to see (Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Grand Bazar en Topkapi Palace. 1 minute from the metro. The rooms are very clean and the bathroom has a jacuzzi!! Breakfast excellent. We had terrible weather but nobody can help that. Everybody who is working at the TAN thank you for making our days so sunny and keep up the good work !! Good restaurant just around the left corner (Rumeli) Only comment is watch the stair to the basement ::))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Clean, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ASFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Tan Hotel in the first week of April. The hotel is located very close to the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, The Cistern and other historic sites. The rooms are clean and while not too big, it was very comfortable for our family (2 adults and 1 child) Even though you are close to all the sites, the hotel is tucked away and very quiet. There is a rooftop restaurant where breakfast (with a wide selection of dry fruits) is served and don't miss the delicious made to order omelettes.The entire staff is very friendly and pleasant - starting with Tahir (the manager), the maids and the server at the restaurant. When we return to Istanbul, we will definitely stay at the Tan Hotel. We recommend this hotel to family, individuals or couples. Whether making reservations, enquiring about sites to visit or to have intellectual discussions on politics or history, talk to Tahir. Safe Travels, AS

Reviews.Title: “Tan Hotel is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: gull9832
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of ten nights at this wonderful little hotel, and loved everything about it. The driver met us at the airport with a smile an a handshake despite our plane being over an hour late. The Tan is quite new, but small enough that it has the â€œboutiqueâ€� feel, so guests get personal attention. The staff, from the chambermaids to the manager, are friendly and helpful, seemed like old friends by the end of our visit. The decor is clean and simple, the beds with their snowy duvets comfortable. There is no charge for the in-room safes, or use of the computers in the lounge and breakfast/bar area. The complementary breakfast in the scenic roof restaurant is generous, with cheeses, cold meats, yogurt, pastries, crudities, cold cereals, juice, coffee, and eggs or omelets cooked quickly to your liking. The hotelâ€™s location is ideal. Since it is off the main street, tucked into a short cobblestone alley lined with small restaurants and shops, it is nice and quiet, but still is within walking distance of Aga Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Ethnic Museum, and even the Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. If you donâ€™t feel like walking, the tram stop is only a half minute away. Although the hotel doesnâ€™t serve lunch or dinner, there are plenty of restaurants nearby, including sidewalk cafes serving delicious â€œTurkish pizzaâ€� on fantastic pide flatbread dough. Also within a block or two are a currency exchange, a pharmacy, an ATM and a shop that serves up really great ice cream. In the middle of our visit weâ€™d taken a 3 day tour, based at a really bad hotel in Kasadusi, and returning to the Tan was a huge relief, like coming home! They even gave us a suite when we returned, at no additional cost to the single room rate. I highly recommend this great little hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a great talent arrived at tan hotel”
Reviews.Author: sakurasakura
Reviews.Content: I and my husband used to travel forgin countrys and Istanbul is one of our favorite city. Every year we try to spend in Istanbul. we usually stayed in Sebnem hotel. It is a really cozy hotel and we liked the manager Tahir there. we heard he changed his job and started to wrok at Tan hotel. This time we tryed to stay the hotel where he works. Tan hotel is a real treasure for us, nice, clean, fresh and very friendly. The room we stayed has a great bathroom with jacuzzi !The terrace with great view, breakfast, bar .. so comfortable, and of course spending some time with Tahir and get some advices about turkey. i can highly recommend this hotel, Excellent! sakura & benihana tokyo Japan

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value at the Tan”
Reviews.Author: kiwiandrea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tan Hotel in March for a long weekend. There is nothing that I can say to fault this hotel... location is excellent, being right on the doorstep of The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, The Underground Cistern, Grand Bazaar and metres away from the Sultanahmet tram stop on Divan Yolu. The hotel itself? Impeccably cleanrooms, very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable staff, superb breakfast which offers both Turkish and European cuisine. Rooms all have the expected comforts of a boutique hotel... including mini bar, wireless network and safety deposit box. Even though Tan is in the middle of Sultanahmet, being tucked away on a side street off Divan Yolu ensures that anyone's stay is a peaceful one. No hesitation in recommending this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: anchi100
Reviews.Content: HI! I've been to Istanbul many times and it is always a pleasure to get back to this amazing city and to one of my favourites - Tan Hotel. It offers very good value and makes the stay in the city very pleasant and easy. The atmosphere in the hotel is warm and friendly, I felt instantly welcome when I first arrived there. I recommended this hotel to several friends who all shared my opinion. The best things I like about it: - location, in the very heart of Sultanahmet. You are absorbed by magic sights and sounds. All historical highlights (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar) are within easy walking distance; also the tram line is only few steps away which makes it very convenient to travel to other parts of town; - breakfasts on the roof terrace with great views over Sultanahmet. It is such a pleasant way to start the day in Istanbul :). The food is delicious, so are the views :) - the staff. Everyone in this hotel was so welcoming and nice. They do arrange pick up from the airport. I usually take a cab but my friends used their service and were satisfied. The reception, Cihan, is always ready to give updated info on what's happening in Istanbul and help with directions and any other questions. The Manager Tahir is a great guy who makes everyone very welcome. I particularly liked that he knew so much about Turkey in general and he gave me some very useful tips for other cities / places I wanted to visit there. I hope to be back to Istanbul soon and I will definitely stay in Tan again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern and elegant Hotel in the center of the history with friendly stuff!”
Reviews.Author: orlandomagic
Reviews.Content: Firtfully we want to say hi to all friendly stuff ( Ozlem, Cihan and Onur ) of Tan Hotel!!! Before we had this excellent experience honestly we were not sure about our choice. Now we are pretty sure about Tan Hotel. We decided to stay at Tan because of its location but beside this we surprised about the modern and elegant decor with, high quality service and also friendly stuff. A hip boutique Hotel like New York sytle. Our room was a suit room which has seperate relaxing room with TV, confortable couch and mini bar. Also safe was in the closet. Room and bathroom were clean and all the stuff we need as towels, shampoos, soaps, sleepers, toilet papers were replacing with the cleans daily. After exhausting day relaxing in the jacuzzi was fantastic. We were having breakfast at the roof restaurant which serves open buffet breakfast that I can not forget. Especially delicious white Turkish cheese and special omlettes. I want to mention that the room service is avaliable 24 hours. The stuff is really helpfull about everything. Loundry, mails, maps, historical tours...etc. If we decide to go to Istanbul we will definitly stay at Tan Hotel. And we recommend it to all tripadvisor members. It was an extra ordinary stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler981
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Istanbul, and this hotel had a lot to do with that. It's a little hard to find the first time, but it's in a great location - easy walking to everything in the old city, Topkapi Palace, the great mosques, Grand Bazaar, etc. We even walked back from the Spice Market and Galata Bridge one night. The tram is just steps away. And there are good restaurants, wonderful bakeries, a great Turkish Delights store, banks and souvenir shops within blocks. And the hosts are really nice people. The room was very quiet, except that we had to keep the window open at night, and were wakened early by the morning call to prayer. That's because the central air conditioner was turned off too soon, and it was pretty warm at night. Also, there were too few hooks in the bathroom. Breakfasts were complete, generous and very enjoyable, made more so by the views from the top floor. We even sat outside on the top-floor patio one afternoon, just to relax. We heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Boutique Hotel in the heart of SultanAhmet!”
Reviews.Author: underthetuscansun
Reviews.Content: We Loved the Tan Hotel because of its convenient location and for its friendly staff. Our room was a suite one bedroom, Spacious bathroom, mini bar, safe. We loved having breakfast on the rooftop restaurant with the most beautiful view of the Blue Mosque. Breakfast was declicious, we particularly loved omeletes and wide array of food in the buffet. Location was perfect, Hotel Tan is right across the street from the Blue Mosque. The staff was very helpful and friendly especially Ozlem and Cihan. They were both such wonderful hosts, We thank you for making our stay in Istanbul a memorable one. I congratulate and thank Tan Hotel for giving their guests such an acceptional service. I would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, 2 adults and 2 kids”
Reviews.Author: mizaan
Reviews.Content: Hi Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with two infants and must say overall it was great. Friendly staff, decent rooms. Terrace was great and overall it was very clean and contemporary. Would definetely stay here again as it is very close to Blue Mosque, Aghia Sophia and Topkapi palace

HotelInfo.Name: Tan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Catalcesme Meydani | Doktor Emin Pasa Sok. No: 16, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
